Notes: Classified reviewer recommendations as "accept," "minor revision," "major revision," and "reject." The "Not China," "Not Asia," and "English" data are all reviewers from the United States and the United Kingdom. "Asia" and "ESL_all" are all reviewers/authors from China

The coding doesn't fit well in the labels we created to use across diverse studies. Functional Ecology changed their scoring system between the first two years and last two years of this study. 2010-2011: 1 = accept following minor revision, 2 = requires major revision, 3 = reject because not important or general enough for Functional Ecology, 4 = reject because quality of data or manuscript not adequate for Functional Ecology. 2012-2014: changed to be descriptive of 1 = novel in top 10% of papers in ecology, 2 = strong contribution to the field of ecology, 3 = solid work but confirmatory, and 4 = weak or flawed and not of enough importance/general interest for Functional Ecology. Finally, the Dryad data for Gender_1 for this study only had reviewer gender paired with author gender for papers that had both a male and female reviewer, so this is only a subset of the data.
